top_categories.workout_context: At 100 miles, Dirty 30 punishes athletes who haven’t trained their body to produce power when glycogen runs low.
Dirty 30 rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Racing Dirty 30 isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Dirty 30’s michigan forest roads, rural gravel demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Dirty 30. Make this intensity feel like home.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Dirty 30 when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Every session at Dirty 30 intensity builds on this aerobic foundation — the endurance base is the soil everything else grows in.
At 100 miles, Dirty 30 rewards a massive aerobic engine. This volume work builds the fat-oxidation capacity that keeps you moving when glycogen runs low.
Blended sessions combine endurance with intensity spikes — exactly what Dirty 30’s rolling michigan gravel delivers on race day.
Dirty 30’s rolling michigan gravel and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
The Norwegian double-threshold method builds the sustained power base for Dirty 30 — massive training stimulus without the recovery cost of VO2max work.
The varied gradients at Dirty 30 reward climbing adaptability — knowing when to sit, when to stand, and when to switch.

race_overlay.heat: April in Saranac, Michigan can bring heat. Complete 3–4 heat exposure sessions in the final 2 weeks before Dirty 30. Increase sodium intake 48 hours before race day.
race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for Dirty 30’s 100 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Dirty 30 requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on rolling michigan gravel to build confidence. Expect: michigan forest roads, rural gravel, rolling hills.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Durability, TT Threshold, and Race Simulation to prepare you for 100 miles of rolling michigan gravel in Saranac, Michigan.
